head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Leash-Free Dogs At Night In City Parks

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: Leash-Free Dogs At Night In City Parks

body.head.byline: By TIMOTHY WILLIAMS; Compiled by John Sullivan

block.p: The Parks and Recreation Department announced yesterday that a policy of allowing dogs off leashes during overnight hours will become effective next month. Beginning May 10, owners with a license and proof of a current rabies vaccination will be permitted to let their dogs roam in designated areas of city parks from 9 p.m. to 9 a.m. Under an unofficial policy, the department has for years not given tickets to dog owners who let their pets run free at night in parks.

The Parks and Recreation Department announced yesterday that a policy of allowing dogs off leashes during overnight hours will become effective next month. Beginning May 10, owners with a license and proof of a current rabies vaccination will be permitted to let their dogs roam in designated areas of city parks from 9 p.m. to 9 a.m. Under an unofficial policy, the department has for years not given tickets to dog owners who let their pets run free at night in parks.
